papers.summary: PandaGPT is an approach to emPower large lANguage moDels with visual and Auditory instruction-following capabilities that can perform complex tasks such as detailed image description generation, writing stories inspired by videos, and answering questions about audios.

papers.title: NavGPT: Explicit Reasoning in Vision-and-Language Navigation with Large Language Models
papers.authors: Gengze Zhou,Yicong Hong,Qi Wu
papers.summary: The NavGPT is introduced, a purely LLM-based instruction-following navigation agent, to reveal the reasoning capability of GPT models in complex embodied scenes by performing zero-shot sequential action prediction for vision-and-language navigation (VLN).

papers.title: CrossGET: Cross-Guided Ensemble of Tokens for Accelerating Vision-Language Transformers
papers.authors: Dachuan Shi,Chaofan Tao,Anyi Rao,Zhendong Yang,Chun Yuan,Jiaqi Wang
papers.summary: Performed experiments are conducted on various vision-language tasks, including image-text retrieval, visual reasoning, image captioning, and visual question answering, demonstrating the effectiveness and versatility of the proposed \textit{CrossGET} framework.

papers.title: Chatting Makes Perfect: Chat-based Image Retrieval
papers.authors: Matan Levy,Rami Ben-Ari,N. Darshan,D. Lischinski
papers.summary: This work introduces ChatIR: a chat-based image retrieval system that engages in a conversation with the user to elicit information, in addition to an initial query, in order to clarify the user's search intent.

papers.title: Dense and Aligned Captions (DAC) Promote Compositional Reasoning in VL Models
papers.authors: Sivan Doveh,Assaf Arbelle,Sivan Harary,Roei Herzig,Donghyun Kim,Paola Cascante-Bonilla,Amit Alfassy,R. Panda,R. Giryes,R. Feris,S. Ullman,Leonid Karlinsky
papers.summary: A fine-tuning approach is proposed for automatically treating two factors limiting the VL models' compositional reasoning performance: the caption quality, or in other words `image-alignment', of the texts and the `density' of the captions in the sense of mentioning all the details appearing on the image.

papers.title: Exploring Open-Vocabulary Semantic Segmentation without Human Labels
papers.authors: Jun Chen,Deyao Zhu,Guocheng Qian,Bernard Ghanem,Zhicheng Yan,Chenchen Zhu,Fanyi Xiao,Mohamed Elhoseiny,S. Culatana
papers.summary: This work presents ZeroSeg, a novel method that leverages the existing pretrained vision-language (VL) model to train open-vocabulary zero-shot semantic segmentation models, achieving state-of-the-art performance when compared to other zero- shot segmentation methods under the same training data, while also performing competitively compared to strongly supervised methods.

papers.title: GPT4Image: Can Large Pre-trained Models Help Vision Models on Perception Tasks?
papers.authors: N. Ding,Yehui Tang,Zhongqian Fu,Chaoting Xu,Kai Han,Yunhe Wang
papers.summary: This paper presents a new learning paradigm in which the knowledge extracted from large pre-trained models are utilized to help models like CNN and ViT learn enhanced representations and achieve better performance.

papers.title: Youku-mPLUG: A 10 Million Large-scale Chinese Video-Language Dataset for Pre-training and Benchmarks
papers.authors: Haiyang Xu,Qinghao Ye,Xuan-Wei Wu,Mingshi Yan,Yuan Miao,Jiabo Ye,Guohai Xu,Anwen Hu,Yaya Shi,Guangwei Xu,Chenliang Li,Qingfang Qian,Maofei Que,Ji Zhang,Xiaoyan Zeng,Feiyan Huang
papers.summary: The zero-shot instruction understanding experiment indicates that pretraining with Youku-mPLUG can enhance the ability to comprehend overall and detailed visual semantics, recognize scene text, and leverage open-domain knowledge.

papers.title: M3IT: A Large-Scale Dataset towards Multi-Modal Multilingual Instruction Tuning
papers.authors: Lei Li,Yuwei Yin,Shicheng Li,Liang Chen,Peiyi Wang,Shuhuai Ren,Mukai Li,Yazheng Yang,Jingjing Xu,Xu Sun,Lingpeng Kong,Qi Liu
papers.summary: Ying-VLM, a VLM model trained on the M$^3$IT dataset, is developed, showcasing its potential to answer complex questions requiring world knowledge, generalize to unseen video tasks, and comprehend unseen instructions in Chinese.

papers.title: Artificial General Intelligence for Medical Imaging
papers.authors: Xiang Li,Lu Zhang,Zihao Wu,Zheng Liu,Lin Zhao,Yixuan Yuan,Jun Liu,Gang Li,Dajiang Zhu,Pingkuan Yan,Quanzheng Li,W. Liu,Tianming Liu,Dinggang Shen
papers.summary: In this review, the importance of integrating clinical expertise, domain knowledge, and multimodal capabilities into AGI models, focusing on foundational Large Language Models, Large Vision Models, and Large Multimodal Models, is emphasized.

papers.title: Modular Visual Question Answering via Code Generation
papers.venue: Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics
papers.authors: Sanjay Subramanian,Medhini G. Narasimhan,Kushal Khangaonkar,Kevin Yang,Arsha Nagrani,C. Schmid,Andy Zeng,Trevor Darrell,D. Klein
papers.summary: This work presents a framework that formulates visual question answering as modular code generation that requires no additional training and relies on pre- trained language models, visual models pre-trained on image-caption pairs, and fifty VQA examples used for in-context learning.

papers.title: Video-ChatGPT: Towards Detailed Video Understanding via Large Vision and Language Models
papers.authors: Muhammad Maaz,Hanoona Rasheed,Salman Khan,F. Khan
papers.summary: This work introduces Video-ChatGPT, a multimodal model that merges a video-adapted visual encoder with a LLM, and develops a quantiative evaluation framework for video-based dialogue models to objectively analyse the strengths and weaknesses of proposed models.

papers.title: Customizing General-Purpose Foundation Models for Medical Report Generation
papers.authors: Bang Yang,Asif Raza,Yuexian Zou,Tong Zhang
papers.summary: This work proposes customizing off-the-shelf general-purpose large-scale pre-trained models, i.e., foundation models (FMs), in computer vision and natural language processing with a specific focus on medical report generation and demonstrates that unfreezing EVA-ViT-g to learn medical image representations, followed by parameter-efficient training of ChatGLM-6B to capture the writing styles of medical reports, is essential for achieving optimal results.

papers.title: Tell Me Where to Go: A Composable Framework for Context-Aware Embodied Robot Navigation
papers.authors: Harel Biggie,Ajay Narasimha Mopidevi,Dusty Woods,C. Heckman
papers.summary: NavCon is developed, a low-bandwidth framework that solves the lack of real-world generalization in Large Language Models by creating an intermediate layer between an LLM and a robot navigation framework in the form of Python code.

papers.title: LVLM-eHub: A Comprehensive Evaluation Benchmark for Large Vision-Language Models
papers.authors: Peng Xu,Wenqi Shao,Kaipeng Zhang,Peng Gao,Shuo Liu,Meng Lei,Fanqing Meng,Siyuan Huang,Y. Qiao,Ping Luo
papers.summary: A comprehensive evaluation of publicly available large multimodal models by building a LVLM evaluation Hub (LVLM-eHub), which provides a foundational framework for the conception and assessment of innovative strategies aimed at enhancing zero-shot multimodals techniques.

papers.title: MotionGPT: Finetuned LLMs are General-Purpose Motion Generators
papers.authors: Yaqi Zhang,Di Huang,B. Liu,Shixiang Tang,Yan Lu,Lu Chen,Lei Bai,Q. Chu,Nenghai Yu,Wanli Ouyang
papers.summary: This paper presents a Motion General-Purpose generaTor (MotionGPT) that can use multimodal control signals, e.g., text and single-frame poses, for generating consecutive human motions by treating multimmodal signals as special input tokens in large language models (LLMs).

papers.title: Path to Medical AGI: Unify Domain-specific Medical LLMs with the Lowest Cost
papers.authors: Juexiao Zhou,Xiuying Chen,Xin Gao
papers.summary: This work proposes Medical AGI (MedAGI), a paradigm to unify domain-specific medical LLMs with the lowest cost, and suggests a possible path to achieve medical AGI.

papers.title: Aligning Large Multi-Modal Model with Robust Instruction Tuning
papers.authors: Fuxiao Liu,Kevin Lin,Linjie Li,Jianfeng Wang,Yaser Yacoob,Lijuan Wang
papers.summary: This paper introduces the first large and diverse visual instruction tuning dataset, named Large-scale Robust Visual (LRV)-Instruction, and proposes GPT4-Assisted Visual Instruction Evaluation (GAVIE), a novel approach to evaluate visual instruction tuned without the need for human-annotated groundtruth answers and can adapt to diverse instruction formats.

papers.title: Are aligned neural networks adversarially aligned?
papers.authors: Nicholas Carlini,Milad Nasr,Christopher A. Choquette-Choo,Matthew Jagielski,Irena Gao,Anas Awadalla,Pang Wei Koh,Daphne Ippolito,Katherine Lee,Florian Tramèr,Ludwig Schmidt
papers.summary: It is shown that existing NLP-based optimization attacks are insufficiently powerful to reliably attack aligned text models, and conjecture that improved NLP attacks may demonstrate this same level of adversarial control over text-only models.

papers.title: Large Multimodal Models: Notes on CVPR 2023 Tutorial
papers.authors: Chunyuan Li

papers.title: Explainable Multimodal Emotion Reasoning
papers.authors: Zheng Lian,Licai Sun,Mingyu Xu,Haiyang Sun,Ke Xu,Zhuofan Wen,Shun Chen,B. Liu,Jianhua Tao
papers.summary: This paper proposes the first multimodal large language model (LLM) in affective computing, called AffectGPT, which aims to tackle the long-standing challenge of label ambiguity and chart a path toward more reliable techniques.

papers.title: Shikra: Unleashing Multimodal LLM's Referential Dialogue Magic
papers.authors: Ke Chen,Zhao Zhang,Weili Zeng,Richong Zhang,Feng Zhu,Rui Zhao
papers.summary: This paper proposes an MLLM called Shikra, which can handle spatial coordinate inputs and outputs in natural language, and can naturally handle location-related tasks like REC and PointQA, as well as conventional VL tasks such as Image Captioning and VQA.

papers.title: LLaVAR: Enhanced Visual Instruction Tuning for Text-Rich Image Understanding
papers.authors: Yanzhe Zhang,Ruiyi Zhang,Jiuxiang Gu,Yufan Zhou,Nedim Lipka,Diyi Yang,Tongfei Sun
papers.summary: This work enhances the current visual instruction tuning pipeline with text-rich images by substantially improves the LLaVA model's capability on text-based VQA datasets and shows promising interaction skills with humans based on the latest real-world online content that combines text and images.

papers.title: Look, Remember and Reason: Visual Reasoning with Grounded Rationales
papers.authors: Apratim Bhattacharyya,Sunny Panchal,Mingu Lee,R. Pourreza,Pulkit Madan,R. Memisevic
papers.summary: This work introduces rationales over the visual input that allow for low-level visual capabilities, such as object recognition and tracking, as surrogate tasks to solve visual reasoning problems.

papers.title: JourneyDB: A Benchmark for Generative Image Understanding
papers.authors: Junting Pan,Keqiang Sun,Yuying Ge,Hao Li,Haodong Duan,Xiaoshi Wu,Renrui Zhang,Aojun Zhou,Zipeng Qin,Yi Wang,Jifeng Dai,Y. Qiao,Hongsheng Li
papers.summary: A large-scale dataset, JourneyDB, for multi-modal visual understanding in generative images, and 4 benchmarks to quantify the performance of generated image understanding in terms of both content and style interpretation are presented.

papers.title: Embodied Task Planning with Large Language Models
papers.authors: Zhenyu Wu,Ziwei Wang,Xiuwei Xu,Jiwen Lu,H. Yan
papers.summary: Experimental results show that the generated plan from the TaPA framework can achieve higher success rate than LLaVA and GPT-3.5 by a sizable margin, which indicates the practicality of embodied task planning in general and complex environments.

papers.title: MultiQG-TI: Towards Question Generation from Multi-modal Sources
papers.venue: Workshop on Innovative Use of NLP for Building Educational Applications
papers.authors: Zichao Wang,Richard Baraniuk
papers.summary: A simple solution is proposed for the new problem of automatic question generation from multi-modal sources containing images and texts, called MultiQG-TI, which enables a text-only question generator to process visual input in addition to textual input.

papers.title: T2I-CompBench: A Comprehensive Benchmark for Open-world Compositional Text-to-image Generation
papers.authors: Kaiyi Huang,Kaiyue Sun,Enze Xie,Zhenguo Li,Xihui Liu
papers.summary: This work proposes T2I-CompBench, a comprehensive benchmark for open-world compositional text-to-image generation, and introduces a new approach, Generative mOdel fine-tuning with Reward-driven Sample selection (GORS), to boost the compositionalText to image generation abilities of pretrained text- to-image models.

papers.title: MMBench: Is Your Multi-modal Model an All-around Player?
papers.authors: Yuanzhan Liu,Haodong Duan,Yuanhan Zhang,Bo Li,Songyang Zhang,Wangbo Zhao,Yike Yuan,Jiaqi Wang,Conghui He,Ziwei Liu,Kai Chen,Dahua Lin
papers.summary: MMBench is a systematically-designed objective benchmark for robustly evaluating the various abilities of vision-language models, and it is hoped MMBench will assist the research community in better evaluating their models and encourage future advancements in this domain.

papers.title: VoxPoser: Composable 3D Value Maps for Robotic Manipulation with Language Models
papers.authors: Wenlong Huang,Chen Wang,Ruohan Zhang,Yunzhu Li,Jiajun Wu,Li Fei-Fei
papers.summary: This work aims to synthesize robot trajectories, i.e., a dense sequence of 6-DoF end-effector waypoints, for a large variety of manipulation tasks given an open set of instructions and an open-set of objects, and presents a large-scale study of the proposed method in both simulated and real-robot environments.

papers.title: InternVid: A Large-scale Video-Text Dataset for Multimodal Understanding and Generation
papers.authors: Yi Wang,Yinan He,Yizhuo Li,Kunchang Li,Jiashuo Yu,X. Ma,Xinyuan Chen,Yaohui Wang,Ping Luo,Ziwei Liu,Yali Wang,Limin Wang,Y. Qiao
papers.summary: A scalable approach to autonomously build a high-quality video-text dataset with large language models (LLM), thereby showcasing its efficacy in learning video-language representation at scale and introducing ViCLIP, a video- Text representation learning model based on ViT-L.

papers.title: Planting a SEED of Vision in Large Language Model
papers.authors: Yuying Ge,Yixiao Ge,Ziyun Zeng,Xintao Wang,Ying Shan
papers.summary: This study identifies two crucial principles for the architecture and training of SEED that effectively ease subsequent alignment with LLMs, and emphasizes the great potential of discrete visual tokens in versatile multimodal LLMs and the importance of proper image tokenizers in broader research.

papers.title: Interpreting Art by Leveraging Pre-Trained Models
papers.venue: 2023 18th International Conference on Machine Vision and Applications (MVA)
papers.authors: Niklas Penzel,J. Denzler
papers.summary: This work uses language and vision models to extract and generate a challenging language vision task in the form of artwork interpretation pairs and combines and fine-tune CLIP as well as GPT-2 to reduce compute requirements for training interpretation models.

papers.title: RSGPT: A Remote Sensing Vision Language Model and Benchmark
papers.authors: Yuan Hu,Jianlong Yuan,Congcong Wen,Xiaonan Lu,Xiang Li
papers.summary: A high-quality Remote Sensing Image Captioning dataset (RSICap) is built that facilitates the development of large VLMs in the RS field and provides a benchmark evaluation dataset called RSIEval, which consists of human-annotated captions and visual question-answer pairs, allowing for a comprehensive assessment of VL Ms in the context of RS.
